description.narrative: 1. Increased access to finance: IFC''s investment will enable the company increase access to finance for SMEs, its major clients. Access to equipment finance benefits SME''s by improving their cash management and operational efficiency. 2. Catalytic role: IFC will help to demonstrate the strength of Custom Capital business and enable it to build the two to three year track record required to successfully access the capital markets and broaden its investor base. The transaction would further provide a demonstration effect and further establish SME leases as an asset class in the South African capital market.

The project consists of IFC supporting the establishment of a securitization program of SME equipment rental contracts originated and serviced by Custom Capital (Pty) Ltd (CC), an equipment rental company acquired by Mercantile Bank Limited (MBL) in 2011. Initially the portfolio size is proposed to be approx. ZAR 350 million, but is expected to grow over time. Under the project, IFC would purchase a ZAR denominated senior note of up to ZAR 240 million to a newly created, bankruptcy-remote SPV. Custom Capital ("CC") would retain the subordinated notes. IFCs investment ensures initial funding to the SPV with a revolving portfolio of equipment rentals for a period of up to 3 years, after which the programme is expected to issue public securities in the South African capital market.
